metadata.title: PRE 17 06

config.question: Who authored the 1893 paper entitled “The Significance of the Frontier in American History”?

answer_3.response: The 1890 census noted that for the first time in American history, “there can hardly be said to be a frontier line.” Picking up the theme, Frederick Jackson Turner, a young historian at the University of Wisconsin, examined its importance in an influential 1893 paper entitled “The Significance of the Frontier in American History.”
